tool.name: Cut
tool.help:
.. class:: warningmark
**WARNING: This tool breaks column assignments.** To re-establish column assignments run the tools and click on the pencil icon in the latest history item.
.. class:: infomark
The output of this tool is always in tabular format (e.g., if your original delimeter was comma, it will be replaced with tab). For example:
Cutting columns 1 and 3 from::
apple,is,good windows,is,bad
will give::
apple good windows bad
-----
**What it does**
This tool selects (cuts out) specified columns from the dataset.
- Columns are specified as **c1**, **c2**, and so on. Column count begins with **1** - Columns can be specified in any order (e.g., **c2,c1,c6**) - If you specify more columns than actually present - empty spaces will be filled with dots
-----
**Example**
Input dataset (six columns: c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, and c6)::
chr1 10 1000 gene1 0 + chr2 100 1500 gene2 0 +
**cut** on columns "**c1,c4,c6**" will return::
chr1 gene1 + chr2 gene2 +
**cut** on columns "**c6,c5,c4,c1**" will return::
+ 0 gene1 chr1 + 0 gene2 chr2
**cut** on columns "**c8,c7,c4**" will return::
. . gene1 . . gene2
